params.name: itemReference
params.doc: Catalog item reference info

docs.summary: Adds single item to multiple categories, fires as many domain events as many categories were successfully added.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Category id.

params.name: items
params.doc: List of catalog items with reference info.

docs.summary: Adds multiple items to single category, fires as many domain events as many items successfully added.

examples.title: addItemsToCategory example
body: const result = await categories.addItemsToCategory(categoryId, items, options);

params.name: categories
params.doc: List of categories to be created.

docs.summary: Creates multiple categories.

params.name: categoryIds
params.doc: IDs of categories to be deleted.

docs.summary: Deletes multiple categories.

params.name: filter

docs.summary: Delete multiple categories which satisfy the provided filter.

params.name: categoryIds
params.doc: IDs of categories to be updated.

docs.summary: Update `visible` field for multiple categories. If visible is set to false, all subcategories will be set to `visible=false`

params.name: filter

docs.summary: Update `visible` field for categories which satisfy the provided filter. If visible is set to false, all subcategories will be set to `visible=false` as well

params.name: categories
params.doc: List of categories to be updated.

docs.summary:
Update multiple Categories, supports partial update.
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update.
To update visibility, call the BulkSetVisibility endpoint.

params.name: category
params.doc: Category to be created.

docs.summary: Creates a new Category.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Id of the Category to delete.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary: Deletes a Category.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary: Returns arranged items in category
Retrieves the whole categories tree

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Id of the Category to retrieve.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary: Retrieves a category with the provided ID.

examples.title: getCategory example
body: const result = await categories.getCategory(categoryId, treeReference, options);

params.name: itemReference
params.doc: Catalog item reference info.

docs.summary: Returns all category IDs that contain the item and their parent category IDs.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category containing items.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary:
Returns up to 100 items related to requested `category_id` sorted by time when item added to category, descending.
When items added to category in bulk they considered as added at exactly same time so order will be random but always the same.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc:
ID of category.
Item must be direct child of this category, otherwise error returned

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary: Changes position of `item` in category. Will be used when sort items by manual arrangement

examples.title: moveItemInCategory example
body: const result = await categories.moveItemInCategory(categoryId, treeReference, options);

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category to place.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary:
Places category in parent category.
This operation updates `parentCategory` (`id` and `index`) for category with `categoryId` in tree with `treeId`.
This endpoint can be used to move category to different parent in the same tree or to change it's position in current parent.
Query Categories using [WQL - Wix Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language)

params.name: itemReference
params.doc: Catalog item reference info

docs.summary: Removes single item from multiple categories, fires as many domain events as many categories were successfully removed.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: Category id

params.name: items
params.doc: List of catalog items with reference info.

docs.summary: Removed multiple items from single category, fires as many domain events as many items successfully removed.

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

docs.summary:
Set arranged items in category. Will be used when sort items by manual arrangement.
Calling this endpoint overrides existing list of arranged items in category.

examples.title: setArrangedItems example
body: const result = await categories.setArrangedItems(categoryId, treeReference, options);

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category to be updated

docs.summary: Update `visible` field. If visible is set to false, all subcategories will be set to `visible=false`

params.name: _id
params.doc: Category ID.

docs.summary:
Update a Category, supports partial update.
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update.
Each time the category is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

examples.title: updateCategory example
body: const result = await categories.updateCategory(id, category, options);

members.name: breadcrumbs
members.doc:
A category's breadcrumbs, Updated on moved to different parent or on renamed.
This field will only be returned if request.fields contains `BREADCRUMBS`

members.name: description
members.doc: Category description.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Extensions enabling users to save custom data related to the category.

members.name: image
members.doc:
Category image.
Pass existing media ID for image previously saved in Wix media manager.
Pass full image URL to upload an image to Wix media manager.
In case of full url the image will be updated eventually.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name.

members.name: numberOfItems
members.doc: Number of items in this category alone.

members.name: parentCategory
members.doc: The parent category.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: richContentDescription
members.doc:
Category description which supports rich content. It is independent from `description` field and can be used instead of it or in addition to it.
In order to use this field you have to integrate with "Ricos" on frontend side. To learn how to do it visit https://ricos.js.org/.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
A permanent, friendly URL name.
If not provided, on create generated automatically.
When provided, validated and must be unique.

members.name: visible
members.doc:
Whether the category is visible to site visitors in dynamic pages (If not passed, the default is `false`).
Even if visible is `false`, it can still be added manually to static page.
If parent visibility is updated to `false`, all the children visibility will be updated eventually to `false`.
It is not allowed to set visible as `true` if at least one of the parent categories has visible `false`.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: subcategories
members.doc: A list of child categories.

description: Represents a node in the view of categories tree

members.doc: Cell background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.doc: Vertical alignment for the cell's text.

members.doc: Styling for the code block's text.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the collapsible list's container.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text in the list. Either left-to-right or right-to-left.

members.name: expandOnlyOne
members.doc: If `true`, only one item can be expanded at a time.

members.name: initialExpandedItems
members.doc: Sets which items are expanded when the page loads.

members.name: isQapageData
members.doc: If `true`, The collapsible item will appear in search results as an FAQ.

members.doc: The text's background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the oEmbed node's container.

members.name: oembed
members.doc: An [oEmbed](https://www.oembed.com) object.

members.name: src
members.doc: Origin asset source.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the catalog app. For example, the Wix Stores `appId`, or the 3rd-party `appId`.

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `eventId` for Wix Events.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: itemReference
members.doc: Item reference from request.

members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: crop
members.doc: Sets how item images are cropped.

members.name: ratio
members.doc: Item ratio

members.name: spacing
members.doc: The spacing between items in pixels.

members.name: targetSize
members.doc: Desirable dimension for each item in pixels (behvaior changes according to gallery type)

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Category ID.

members.doc: List of catalog items with reference info.

members.name: isMain
members.doc: Whether the keyword is the main focus keyword.

members.name: term
members.doc: Keyword value.

members.name: horizontalScroll
members.doc: Sets whether horizontal scroll is enabled.

members.name: mobileNumberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on mobile screens.

members.name: numberOfColumns
members.doc: The number of columns to display on full size screens.

members.name: orientation
members.doc: Gallery orientation.

members.name: type
members.doc: Gallery layout type.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: customData
members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: target
members.doc:
he HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link details.

members.name: directCategoryIds

members.name: includeItemsFromSubcategories
members.doc: Default: `false`. When `false` only direct items of category will be returned. When `true` response contains also items from all subcategories which current category contains

members.name: paging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `use_category_arrangement` or `include_items_from_subcategories`.

members.name: useCategoryArrangement
members.doc: Default: `false`. When `true` items arranged by user will be return before all other items.

members.name: categoryId

members.name: mapType

members.name: marker
members.doc: Sets whether the location marker is visible.

members.name: streetViewControl
members.doc: Sets whether street view control is enabled.

members.name: viewModeControl
members.doc: Sets whether view mode control is enabled.

members.name: zoomControl
members.doc: Sets whether zoom control is enabled.

members.name: category

members.name: duration
members.doc: Media duration in seconds. Only relevant for audio and video files.

members.doc: Media height in pixels.

members.name: src
members.doc: The source for the media's data.

members.name: width
members.doc: Media width in pixels.

members.doc: Mentioned user's ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: The mentioned user's name.

members.name: slug
members.doc: The version of the user's name that appears after the `@` character in the mention.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Object ID.

members.name: createdTimestamp
members.doc: When the object was created.

members.name: updatedTimestamp
members.doc: When the object was most recently updated.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schema version.

members.name: beforeItem
members.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. `before_item` must be manually arranged item.

members.name: item
members.doc: Item to move.

members.name: position
members.doc:
Where to move item.
`FIRST` - make `item` first item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, the 100th item will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make `item` last item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, moving item will be not last but 100th.
`BEFORE` - requires `before_item`, `item` will be moved before it. If `before_item` was 100th item in category it will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`NONE` - don't use manual arrangement for `item`, it will be shown after all items with manual arrangement according to default sorting.

members.name: beforeItem
members.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. `before_item` must be manually arranged item.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc:
ID of category.
Item must be direct child of this category, otherwise error returned

members.name: item
members.doc: Item to move.

members.name: position
members.doc:
Where to move item.
`FIRST` - make `item` first item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, the 100th item will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make `item` last item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, moving item will be not last but 100th.
`BEFORE` - requires `before_item`, `item` will be moved before it. If `before_item` was 100th item in category it will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`NONE` - don't use manual arrangement for `item`, it will be shown after all items with manual arrangement according to default sorting.

members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.doc: The image displayed with the option.

members.doc: Option title.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display option images.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF download button is disabled.

members.name: disablePrint
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF print button is disabled.

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:
`NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.
`FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.
`MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level from 1-6.

members.name: textStyle
members.doc: Styling for the paragraph text.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Represents the id of the parent category.
If not passed, the default is the root category.

members.name: index
members.doc: Represents the index of current category within the parent category.

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: vote
members.doc: Sets who can vote.

members.name: moveBeforeCategoryId
members.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. Otherwise ignored

members.name: parentCategoryId
members.doc:
ID of parent category.
Optional. When not passed it will fallback to the root category

members.name: position
members.doc:
Where to place the subcategory.
`FIRST` - make category with `category_id` first subcategory with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make category with `category_id` last subcategory with manual arrangement.
`BEFORE` - requires `move_before_category_id`, category with `category_id` will be moved before it.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of category to place.

members.name: moveBeforeCategoryId
members.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. Otherwise ignored

members.name: parentCategoryId
members.doc:
ID of parent category.
Optional. When not passed it will fallback to the root category

members.name: position
members.doc:
Where to place the subcategory.
`FIRST` - make category with `category_id` first subcategory with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make category with `category_id` last subcategory with manual arrangement.
`BEFORE` - requires `move_before_category_id`, category with `category_id` will be moved before it.

members.name: treeReference
members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.name: arrangedCategoriesAfterMove
members.doc: Information about manually arranged categories after move.

members.name: parentCategoryId
members.doc: ID of parent category.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pages author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

members.name: nodes

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: items
members.doc:
List of arranged items to set.
All items must be direct children of category with `category_id`, otherwise error returned.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of category.

members.name: items
members.doc:
List of arranged items to set.
All items must be direct children of category with `category_id`, otherwise error returned.

members.name: treeReference
members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.name: items
members.doc: The updated list of arranged items in category.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Latest revision of the category.

members.name: treeReference
members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.doc: value to set `visible` to

members.name: revision

members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.name: visible
members.doc: value to set `visible` to

members.name: category
members.doc: The updated Category.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node.

members.name: border
members.doc: Border attributes.

members.name: colors
members.doc: Color attributes.

members.name: borderColors
members.doc: The cell's border colors.

members.name: cellStyle
members.doc: Styling for the cell's background color and text alignment.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the table's container.

members.name: dimensions
members.doc: The table's dimensions.

members.name: header
members.doc: Deprecated: Use `rowHeader` and `columnHeader` instead.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type.

Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to apply decorations to.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply to the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: Line height for text in the node.

members.name: nodeStyle
members.doc: Padding and background color for the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: textAlignment
members.doc: Text alignment. Defaults to `AUTO`.

members.name: placement
members.doc: Thumbnail alignment.

members.name: spacing
members.doc: Spacing between thumbnails in pixels.

members.name: appNamespace
members.doc: The unique namespace of the app.

members.name: treeKey
members.doc: Optional - The key of the tree. Must be provided when single app manages more than one tree.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Category was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Category was last updated.

members.name: breadcrumbs
members.doc:
A category's breadcrumbs, Updated on moved to different parent or on renamed.
This field will only be returned if request.fields contains `BREADCRUMBS`

members.name: description
members.doc: Category description.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Extensions enabling users to save custom data related to the category.

members.name: image
members.doc:
Category image.
Pass existing media ID for image previously saved in Wix media manager.
Pass full image URL to upload an image to Wix media manager.
In case of full url the image will be updated eventually.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name.

members.name: numberOfItems
members.doc: Number of items in this category alone.

members.name: parentCategory
members.doc: The parent category.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: richContentDescription
members.doc:
Category description which supports rich content. It is independent from `description` field and can be used instead of it or in addition to it.
In order to use this field you have to integrate with "Ricos" on frontend side. To learn how to do it visit https://ricos.js.org/.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
A permanent, friendly URL name.
If not provided, on create generated automatically.
When provided, validated and must be unique.

members.name: visible
members.doc:
Whether the category is visible to site visitors in dynamic pages (If not passed, the default is `false`).
Even if visible is `false`, it can still be added manually to static page.
If parent visibility is updated to `false`, all the children visibility will be updated eventually to `false`.
It is not allowed to set visible as `true` if at least one of the parent categories has visible `false`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.name: treeReference
members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.name: category
members.doc: Category to be updated, may be partial.

members.name: fields
members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.name: treeReference
members.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

members.name: category
members.doc: The updated Category.

members.name: media
members.doc: Video file details.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail file details.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the video's container.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the video's download button is disabled.

members.name: options
members.doc: Video options.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail details.

members.name: title
members.doc: Video title.

members.name: video
members.doc: Video details.
